Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw and label a fish and other living things that might be found in the water (e.g., plants, other fish).
The student can show the habitat where the fish lives, including water and other elements like rocks or plants.
The student can label the resources a fish needs to survive, such as water and food.
The student can illustrate relationships between the fish and its habitat, showing how the habitat provides what the fish needs (e.g., a pond or a river).
The student can demonstrate how the fish, its habitat, and other living and non-living things work together as a system.
